p.s: The text Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes is about the usefullnessusefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights and in which the author Brian Pollard trytries to bring their opinion against the union and against the big of a role they still have across to the reader.
In the following I will analyze how the author tries to persuade the reader of his opinion and which stylist devices and communicative strategies the writer makes use of.

In the headline of the article the author makes use of a question and directly answeranswers it Is the usefulness [...] coming to an end?The answer is yes to speak directly to the reader to question this themself and to bring them right into the topic of the text.
With the answer the writer makes his position clear right at the beginning what impacts the forming of the reader's opinion.

With the line they have become victims of their own success (l. 11) the author useuses metaphorical language to show how successuccess is not always good and how fast successuccess is mistreated and in this case the unions the ended it also.

In line 15 the author useuses the saying a noted drop in productivity to express how with the success the productivity and the work commitment of the unions suddenly dropped what was clearly noticiballnoticeable.

The line workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees shows how the roles switched and how the original use and mission is not there anymore and to express the power of the unions, which the governments have given them.
